question: In the titration of potassium permanganate <katex>$(KMnO_{4})$</katex> against Ferrous ammonium sulphate (FAS) solution, dilute sulphuric acid but not nitric acid is used to maintain acidic medium, because
choices: It is difficult to identify the end point
Nitric acid doesn't act as an indicator
Nitric acid itself is an oxidizing agent
Nitric acid is a weak acid than sulphuric acid
explanation: Nitric acid is a strong oxidizing agent and would interfere with the redox titration by oxidizing the ferrous ions itself.
